verses.text: A wise judge will instruct his people; And the government of a prudent \add man\add* is well ordered.
As the judge of the people is himself, so \add are\add* his officers; And what manner of man the ruler of the city is, \add such are\add* all they that dwell therein.
An unwise king destroyeth his people; But through the prudence of them which are in authority the city shall be inhabited.
The power of the earth \add is\add* in the hand of the Lord, And in due time he will set over it one that is profitable.
In the hand of God \add is\add* the prosperity of man: And upon the person of the scribe shall he lay his honour.
Bear not hatred to \add thy\add* neighbour for every wrong; And do nothing at all by injurious practices.
Pride \add is\add* hateful before God and man: And by both doth \add one\add* commit iniquity.
Because of unrighteous dealings, injuries, and riches got by deceit, The kingdom is translated from one people to another.

Why is earth and ashes proud? \add There is\add* not a more wicked \add thing\add* than a covetous \add man:\add* For such an one setteth his own soul to sale; Because while he liveth he casteth away his bowels.
The physician cutteth off a long disease; And \add he that is\add* to day a king to morrow shall die.
For when a man is dead, He shall inherit creeping things, beasts, and worms.
The beginning of pride \add is\add* when one departeth from God, And his heart is turned away from his Maker.

For pride \add is\add* the beginning of sin, And he that hath it shall pour out abomination: \add And\add* therefore the Lord brought upon \add them\add* strange calamities, And overthrew them utterly.
The Lord hath cast down the thrones of \add proud\add* princes, And set up the meek in their stead.
The Lord hath plucked up the roots of the proud nations, And planted the lowly in their place.
The Lord overthrew countries of the heathen, And destroyed them to the foundations of the earth.
He took \add some\add* of them away, and destroyed them, And hath made their memorial to cease from the earth.
Pride was not made for men, Nor furious anger for them that are born of a woman.

They that fear the Lord \add are\add* a sure seed, And they that love him an honourable plant: They that regard not the law \add are\add* a dishonourable seed; They that transgress the commandments \add are\add* a deceivable seed.
Among brethren he that is chief \add is\add* honourable; So are they that fear the Lord in his eyes.
The fear of the Lord \add goeth\add* before the obtaining of authority: But roughness and pride \add is\add* the losing thereof.
\add Whether\add* he \add be\add* rich, noble, or poor, Their glory \add is\add* the fear of the Lord.
\add It is\add* not meet to despise the poor \add man\add* that hath understanding; Neither is it convenient to magnify a sinful man.
Great men, and judges, and potentates, shall be honoured; Yet is there none of them greater than he that feareth the Lord.
Unto the servant \add that is\add* wise shall \add they that are\add* free do service: And he that hath knowledge will not grudge when he is reformed.
Be not overwise in doing thy business; And boast not thyself in the time of thy distress.
Better \add is\add* he that laboureth, and aboundeth in all \add things\add*, Than he that boasteth himself, and wanteth bread.
\add My\add* son, glorify thy soul in meekness, And give it honour according to the dignity thereof.
Who will justify him that sinneth against his own soul? And who will honour him that dishonoureth his own life?
The poor \add man\add* is honoured for his skill, And the rich \add man\add* is honoured for his riches.
He that is honoured in poverty, how much \add more\add* in riches? And \add he that is\add* dishonourable in riches, how much more in poverty?
